contentrichtext.text: {{about|the son of the [[Han Dynasty]] warlord [[Yuan Shu]]|the [[Qing Dynasty]] painter|Yuan Yao (painter)}} {{multiple issues| {{Unreferenced|date=January 2009}} {{In-universe|subject = Three Kingdoms|category = Three Kingdoms|date = October 2009}} }} {{Chinese |t=袁燿 |s=袁耀 }} {{chinese-name|[[Yuan (surname)|Yuan]]}} '''Yuan Yao''' was a son of the warlord [[Yuan Shu]] during the late [[Han Dynasty]] period of [[History of China|Chinese history]]. After Yuan Shu declared himself [[Emperor of China|emperor]], Yuan Yao became the [[crown prince]]. Following the death of Yuan Shu, he then relied on [[Liu Xun (Han Dynasty)|Liu Xun]]. When [[Sun Ce]] followed in his attack on Lujiang, he received his protection. ==See also== *[[List of people of the Three Kingdoms]] {{DEFAULTSORT:Yuan, Yao}} [[Category:Year of birth missing]] [[Category:Year of death missing]] [[Category:Yuan Shu and associates]] [[Category:2nd-century births]] [[Category:3rd-century deaths]] [[Category:Sun Ce and associates]] [[Category:Sun Quan and associates]] [[Category:Eastern Wu politicians]] {{China-bio-stub}}
